properties.name: Ajanta Caves
properties.description: Posted by System    The first Buddhist cave monuments at Ajanta date from the 2nd and 1st centuries B.C. During the Gupta period (5th and 6th centuries A.D.), many more richly decorated caves were added to the original group. The paintings and sculptures of Ajanta, considered masterpieces of Buddhist religious art, have had a considerable artistic influence.

properties.name: Ape Cave
properties.description: Posted by KbeadleMount St. HelensI took my mom to Ape Cave during the winter. We hiked a mile in the snow with our gear. We reached the entrance and she freaked. She started crying and telling me she would do anything else I wanted as long as we didn\'t go in that hole. I was annoyed, frustrated and pushed. No luck. So, we walked back in the rain and snow. As we drove off the car got stuck in snow. We sat for several hours during which time my mom peed on the tires thinking that would help melt the snow and free us from our misery. Eventually we dug ourselves out using a piece of plastic. A few years later my mom, her husband, my brother and I went back. My mom thought she was going to hang out in the car while we did our thing. This time we forced her in the hole (see photo). She lived to tell the tale.

properties.name: Cenote Dzitnup - Lake in a cave
properties.description: Posted by Jason between Tulum and Coba, MexicoSomewhat creepy underground lake with natural spotlight and tons of stalagtites. Local girls swimming in gowns, villagers selling crafts, young boys offering to watch your car for you.

properties.name: Decorated Grottoes of the Vézère Valley
properties.description: Posted by Jklmiller    The Vézère valley contains 147 prehistoric sites dating from the Palaeolithic and 25 decorated caves. It is particularly interesting from an ethnological and anthropological, as well as an aesthetic point of view because of its cave paintings, especially those of the Lascaux Cave, whose discovery in 1940 was of great importance for the history of prehistoric art. The hunting scenes show some 100 animal figures, which are remarkable for their detail, rich colours and lifelike quality.

properties.name: Elephanta Caves
properties.description: Posted by System    The \'City of Caves\', on an island in the Sea of Oman close to Bombay, contains a collection of rock art linked to the cult of Shiva. Here, Indian art has found one of its most perfect expressions, particularly the huge high reliefs in the main cave.

properties.name: Florida Caverns State Park
properties.description: Posted by Urbandragon  Marianna, FloridaFlorida Caverns State Park is a surprising find for people who associate Florida with beaches and alligators - located in the panhandle west of the state capital, Tallahassee, it\'s one of a few open air cave systems in Florida and the only one open for tours. It\'s definitely worth the visit, the trails are a nice hike through limestone and oak, and the half mile cavern tour is very enjoyable.

properties.name: Natural Bridge Caverns, TX
properties.description: Posted by Jintexas 26495 Natural Bridge Cavern Rd, Natural Bridge Caverns, TX 78266(Passage from website) In March of 1960, four college students from St. Mary’s University in San Antonio obtained permission to explore the area that is now Natural Bridge Caverns. The students were convinced that large underground passages existed under the amazing 60-foot limestone bridge. On their fourth expedition, Orion Knox Jr., one of the discoverers, felt a cool draft from a rubble-filled crawlway. Such air currents often indicate the presence of additional rooms or passages. The explorers made their way carefully climbing and crawling through two miles of vast cavern passage. After making this amazing discovery, they returned to the surface to tell the landowners. The discoverers knew immediately what an astonishing find they had made and the land owners decided to develop the first ½ mile, the most spectacular part of the caverns, for the enjoyment of guests from around the world. That first ½ mile is now the North Cavern Tour. Natural Bridge Caverns’ North Cavern Tour was developed with two main goals in mind: preservation of the cavern environment and comfort of its guests. The result is one of the world’s premier show caverns.

properties.name: Space Bike RV Guy
properties.description: Posted by Jason

properties.name: The Ultimate Secure Cave Home
properties.description: Posted by Jason Strategically located in the awesome San Juan mountains of Southwest Colorado, this patented steel-reinforced concrete earth home was built to withstand almost any natural or man-made disaster you can name. It is more secure, safe, and functional than any conventional house could ever be, yet still has a level of comfort that one might not expect to find in an underground home.
